summary: This is an email chain regarding the technical processing of document production in the case US v. Epstein. It discusses a vendor's progress in bates stamping and exporting seven parts of a production dataset (SDNY_PROD015) to a hard drive for review.

events.title: Document Production Progress Update
events.description: A vendor provides an update on the bates stamping and export of a seven-part document production (SDNY_PROD015) for the case US v. Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated November 4, 2020, concerning the case US v. Epstein.
A vendor is processing a document production broken into seven parts, identified as SDNY_PROD015.
At the time of the email, parts 1-3 were finished with bates stamping, part 4 was about to start, and parts 1 and 2 were being exported to a hard drive.
The email provides searchable references (SDNY_PROD015 - PART 01, 02, 03) for reviewing the completed productions.
The correspondence is logistical, focusing on the technical preparation of documents for legal review rather than substantive case details.
